intro: Poitea longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered poitea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, elongated flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets, a common feature in grass family members. Poitea longiflora is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and grassy slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
